title: Cody Simpson impressed Lindsay Lohan guessed him as Robot as he watches himself on The Masked Singer
text:
He's the Australian pop star who's had to keep his latest TV gig a secret for months.

And on Monday, Cody Simpson, 22, took to his Instagram to share his reactions as he watched himself on The Masked Singer grand finale, during which he was unmaked as the Robot.

Sharing a black and white video from his Sydney hotel room, an overexcited Cody sat by the TV as judge Lindsay Lohan chimed in her guess.

She did it! The Masked Singer Australia's Robot Cody Simpson (pictured) was impressed that Lindsay Lohan guessed him right as he watched himself on finale on Monday night

'We have some weird connection and I think you are Cody Simpson,' Lindsay is heard saying in the background on TV.

To which the singer turned to the camera and said: 'Shes right, she's right!'

Before guessing the identity of the LA-based Aussie, Lindsay picked up a few clues that hinted it could be the Golden Thing hitmaker.

Got it! 'We have some weird connection and I think you are Cody Simpson,' Lindsay is heard saying in the background on TV

'The surfing, the waves, coming back home, and my sister Ali dated him so I have a little insight,' she told her judges after guessing Cody.

'If it is you [Cody Simpson], we have a lot to talk about, and this is not the arena for it,' she said cheekily.

The 33-year-old then announced: 'I want my furniture back! Because I bought your furniture for your house in Venice!'

Good work! Before guessing the identity of the LA-based Aussie, Lindsay picked up a few clues that hinted it could be the Golden Thing hitmaker

It's him! Moments later the Waiting For the Tide hitmaker was indeed revealed as the robot

The American actress added, laughingly: 'And if it's not [Cody], I am so sorry.'

Moments later the Waiting For the Tide hitmaker was indeed revealed as the robot.

After the announcement, Lindsay was in a complete state of shock, she added: 'I can't believe this!

Lindsay announced during the episode: 'I want my furniture back 'cause I bought your furniture for your house in Venice!'

'I can't... I can't... I just need a minute. I'm literally in shock right now. I can't even... I'm, like, blushing for my sister, 'cause I know how much she loves you.'

Host Osher Günsberg then joked, 'The big question is, is he going to give you your furniture back?', to which Lindsay replied: 'Where is it, even?'

'I don't know. I don't think it ever showed up, actually,' he replied.
description: He's the Australian pop star who's had to keep his latest TV gig a secret for months.
authors: Ali Daher For Daily Mail Australia
